page.title: 01Derrylin Village
page.content: This a a rural area with a small linear village The landscape consists of small Drumlin Hills with areas of flat land especially around the shore of UpperLhough Erne. The main occupation is farming based on beef and dairy cattle. Arable farming is now existent but sheep are becoming increasingly popular on the recently drained and reseeded areas. Much improvement has taken place on the land in recent years in terms of buildings,concrete lanes, drainage, hedge removal and reseeding. Settlement is concentrated in three small estates in the village and around the village itself while the farming population is dispersed throughout the area alongwith numerous non famring people.
